question:
In context with the World Food Day, the Food Safety Mitra Scheme was launched. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. It was introduced by FSSAI.
  2. Persons in food business can be trained as Food Safety Trainers.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Food Safety Mitra Scheme was launched by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India. This is in context with the World Food Day that is observed on October 16th every year. The scheme seeks to create network of food safety mitras/ FSMs to enable safe food at ground level. Â Statement 2 is correct: The FSMs are trained to be in 3 avatars: Digital Mitra (help with compliance of standards), Hygiene Mitras (hygiene auditors) and Trainer Mitras (provide food safety training). The Digital Mitras are sourced from entrepreneurial and IT professionals. The Hygiene Mitras are sourced from food industry experts while the Trainer Mitras are trained food professionals.
